intro: Lilium martagon var. carneum, commonly known as the Turk's帽 lily, is a striking perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink to red in color, arranged in a distinctive, rounded inflorescence. The plant features long, narrow leaves that are lanceolate in shape, and it produces a tall, sturdy stem that can reach up to 2 meters in height.
